content.question: An engineer finds a material that functions as a compressible dielectric, such that <math alttext="kappa equals b times the fraction d sub 0, over d" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>κ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>b</mi><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="b" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is a constant and <math alttext="d sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is the uncompressed thickness of the dielectric, and <math alttext="d" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the compressed thickness. A capacitor is constructed with conducting plates of area <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and a piece of the compressible dielectric of area <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and initial thickness <math alttext="d sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>. The capacitor is connected to a source of potential difference <math alttext="delta V" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and develops a charge <math alttext="positive Q sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> on the upper plate. When the capacitor is compressed so that its thickness is <math alttext="the fraction d sub 0, over 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, the charge on the upper plate of the capacitor is

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
